verse: Jacob called to his sons and said, “Gather yourselves together, so that I may tell you what will befall you in the last days.
These are all the twelve tribes of Israel, and this is what their father said to them when he blessed them. He blessed them, each with the blessing appropriate to him.
Then he charged them and said to them, “I am about to be gathered to my people. Bury me with my fathers in the cave that is in the field of Ephron the Hittite,
in the cave that is in the field of Machpelah, which is before Mamre in the land of Canaan, which Abraham bought along with the field from Ephron the Hittite as a burial place.
They buried Abraham and Sarah his wife there. They buried Isaac and Rebekah his wife there, and I buried Leah there.
The field and the cave that is there were purchased from the children of Heth.”
When Jacob finished instructing his sons, he drew his feet into the bed, breathed his last, and was gathered to his people.
